commit.message:
test: support dbus-daemon v1.15.2

dbus-daemon v1.15.2 switched from using abstract sockets to path-based
sockets. Let's tweak the reference tests to support both cases.

test: separate reference tests into a suite

Newer meson doesn't like colons in test names:

test/dbus/meson.build:78: DEPRECATION: ":" is not allowed in test name "dbus-daemon(1): Connection", it has been replaced with "_"
test/dbus/meson.build:79: DEPRECATION: ":" is not allowed in test name "dbus-daemon(1): Message passing", it has been replaced with "_"
...

Let's instead separate the reference tests/benchmarks into their own
suite. This also makes running just the reference tests easier by using
meson test's --suite= argument:

$ meson test -C build --list --suite 'dbus-daemon(1)'
dbus-broker:dbus-daemon(1) / Broker API
dbus-broker:dbus-daemon(1) / Driver API
dbus-broker:dbus-daemon(1) / FD Stream Constraints
dbus-broker:dbus-daemon(1) / Client Lifetime
dbus-broker:dbus-daemon(1) / Signals and Matches

test: use get_variable() instead of deprecated get_pkgconfig_variable()

get_pkgconfig_variable() was deprecated in 0.56.0.

test/dbus/meson.build:76: WARNING: Project targets '>=0.60.0' but uses feature deprecated since '0.56.0':
    dependency.get_pkgconfig_variable. use dependency.get_variable(pkgconfig : ...) instead

test: integration tests

Let's follow-up on 0a0b0fa and introduce a second Packit job that runs
integration tests on the just built RPMs in Testing Farm [0].

The test organization and execution is handled by tmt [1]. To not
unnecessarily pollute the dbus-broker's git root, the tmt root is
initialized in the test/integration/ subdirectory (meaning that for the
tmt commands to work correctly you need to be somewhere below this
directory).

Since there are no pre-existing integration tests, add a simple one that
runs dfuzzer on the org.freedesktop.systemd1 D-Bus interface to
exercise dbus-broker a bit. A short README file is provided as well with
instructions on how to easily add a new test case, and with some links
where to find more information about tmt.

[0] https://packit.dev/docs/configuration/upstream/tests
[1] https://tmt.readthedocs.io/en/stable/overview.html

ci: introduce Packit

Build (and test) dbus-broker on all active Fedora releases using Packit.
This uses Fedora's spec file (from Rawhide) with a couple of tweaks, so
we don't have to ship our own.

Replaces: #279

bus/driver: mention peer-name on activation failure errors

Include the name of the activated peer in D-Bus errors when propagating.
We already build custom error descriptions so it is simple to include a
bit more information.

Reported-by: Jake Dane
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: release v35

Release dbus-broker 35.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

launch: drop error-checking remnant of old dir-iteration

When the directory-iteration was changed to use fs_dir_list(), the loop
was changed to no longer check for `errno`. Unfortunately, the trailing
`errno`-check was not dropped. This means any `errno`-leftovers from the
loop will cause the entire operation to fail.

This can certainly happen when we handle syscall/libc failures
gracefully. In particular, this breaks when stale or broken service
files are left on the system.

Fix this and drop the error-checking remnant.

Reported-by: Allison Karlitskaya <allison.karlitskaya@redhat.com>
Reported-by: Lily Danzig <ldenardo@dealerinspire.com>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: release v34

Release dbus-broker 34.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: add system-* targets

Add makefile targets to build and run the system test-image from
./test/image/.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: prepare upcoming release

Create a changelog with all changes since v33 and prepare for the
upcoming release.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

launch: list directories alphabetically

When enumerating directories ensure that we iterate the entries in
alphabetical order.

We used to follow what the reference-implementation does, and simply
read directories in semi-random on-disk order. This is rather brittle
to debug and exposes behavior that we really don't want to expose.
Instead, we want predictable enumerations so policy and service-files
can be more easily traced and debugged.

The downside of ordering directory entries is that we have to collect
all entries first, rather than using the streaming API of the kernel.
Fortunately, this is what we do, anyway, since we already have 1-to-1
mappings of the directory entries to internal data-structures. Hence,
in all our current use-cases, it is not an issue to stream everything
into a collection first.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util: helpers for directory listings

Add helpers around `readdir()` which list directories and collect all
entries in memory.

We usually use readdir() to stream directory entries. However, when
dealing with configuration files, we want predictable source-ordering,
and thus we need to collect the listing into memory and order it.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: pull in newer dependencies

Update the build dependencies to use the newest c-stdaux updates. While
any clean rebuild should update those, we still bump the dependency
versions to ensure we get the fixed pkg-config builds from c-stdaux
across all dependencies.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: add meson-* targets to makefile

Add `meson-*` targets to prepare, build, and test the meson-based
project.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: order executable targets

Add `link_depends:` arguments to Meson targets which require other
executables to be built. Otherwise, `meson test` will not build the
required executables.

While `test()` targets can list other targets as dependency, this is not
possible for `executable()` or `declare_dependency()` targets. Instead,
we use the `link_depends:` argument to get a similar effect. Ideally,
this would not be required, but there seems to be not other way to
declare dependencies on other executables right now.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

build: rework maintenance makefile

Rework the maintenance makefile to provide safe default configurations
and help messages.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/driver: send correct fd-count with credentials

Fix the GetConnectionCredentials() API to send the correct number of FDs
with a message. We have to predict the number of FDs since we write
message headers before their body. This should be fine to predict,
though.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/driver: extract credentials

Extract the credential-set into a structure to make it easier to pass
around. Maybe, at some point, we can even move it into Peer and Broker,
but keep it simple for now and just simplify the driver.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/driver: return ProcessFD via GetConnectionCredentials()

As per the new addition to the D-Bus spec, return the pid FD of the
connection via GetConnectionCredentials(). We only do so if we got the
FD from SO_PEERPIDFD, which is safe against recycle attacks.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

bus/peer: properly fold error domains

Ensure that errors domains from src/util/ are properly folded. The
functions in question do not use any error-domains, but we should still
adhere to the style we use throughout.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

Store pid FD of peer/broker

It will be send out with other credentials.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(properly fold uncaught errors)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: fix SO_PEERPIDFD error code

The queued-patch for SO_PEERPIDFD regarding unsupported socket types has
changed the error code to ENODATA, so ensure that we adapt accordingly.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: detect reaped pidfds

Ensure that we correctly detect reaped pidfds returned by SO_PEERPIDFD.
This might change in the future, but until now this is a reliable error
code used by AF_UNIX.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

test/sockopt: fix stale-test for SO_PEERPIDFD

Fix the SO_PEERPIDFD test to test the pidfd for non-stale scenarios,
rather than stale. We have not decided on how to deal with stale pidfds
yet, so leave this undecided for now.

Reported-by: frkli1965
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

all: make use of misc_memfd()

Rather than open-coding the memfd syscalls, make use of the new
misc_memfd() helpers.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/misc: add memfd utilities

Add proper helpers around memfds. This includes a new memfd-constructor
that follows newest kernel standards around EXEC/NOEXEC handling.

Furthermore, add GET_SEALS and ADD_SEALS wrappers to avoid open-coding
them all over the place.

This does not make use of the new helpers, yet, but only adds tests to
verify their behavior.

Reported-by: Дамјан Георгиевски
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: add tests for SO_PEERPIDFD

Add a test that verifies the behavior of SO_PEERPIDFD depending on the
state of the originally pinned process.

Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/sockopt: add helper to get pid FD from peer

New socket option added in kernel v6.5.

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(Introduce SOCKOPT error domain; add documentation; change signature
 to use the error-domain rather than nullables)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>

util/proc: add helper to resolve a pid file descriptor

A pid FD can be resolved by reading from proc's fdinfo

Signed-off-by: Luca Boccassi <bluca@debian.org>
(rework based on the new proc helpers)
Signed-off-by: David Rheinsberg <david@readahead.eu>
